chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanley D. Langholff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $108
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

---to undergo any assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Department of Corrections 
--Register as a Sex Offender 
--Comply with all sex offender registry requirements and rules 
--No Contact with ATP, except if approved by APT, her biological parents, and Department of Corrections, if contact is being contemplated APT's therapist/counselor (if she has one) is to have input on the contact
--Contact with any child (17 years of age or younger), is to be supervised by a responsible adult. The Court gives the Agent the authority to make more rigorous as necessary
--to provide DNA sample to designee upon demand
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no consumption of alcohol 
--undergo any programming or counseling as determined by the Agent including Psychosexual Assessment 

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:47pm [mo]
Defendant Stanley D. Langholff in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Ahmad requests a brief recess to review letter submitted by victim's father; the Court grants the request
recess:1:48pm--reconvene:2:00pm

ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance; notes that both parents of A.P.T. are present in the Courtroom and that Victim Impact Statements have been submitted. 

The Court requests clarification of the State's proposed Criminal Case Settlement, specifically requiring the Defendant to pay for future treatment and counseling of A.P.T.
--The Court cites Case Law, the State researches Case Law, the State withdraws this request on the CCS

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Beck
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Ahmad
Family members make statement to the Court on behalf of Mr. Langholff
Statement made by Mr. Langholff
recess: 3:15pm--reconvene: 3:26pm

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 10 years, with conditions:
--to serve 1 year in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH

--The Court approves transfer on this jail sentence to Walworth Co., so long as it is served as it would be in Jefferson Co., and that is without electronic monitoring, GPS, or home detention. 
---to undergo any assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Department of Corrections 
--Register as a Sex Offender 
--Comply with all sex offender registry requirements and rules 
--No Contact with ATP, except if approved by APT, her biological parents, and Department of Corrections, if contact is being contemplated APT's therapist/counselor (if she has one) is to have input on the contact
--Contact with any child (17 years of age or younger), is to be supervised by a responsible adult. The Court gives the Agent the authority to make more rigorous as necessary
--to provide DNA sample to designee upon demand
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no consumption of alcohol 
--undergo any programming or counseling as determined by the Agent including Psychosexual Assessment 
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $108
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Cash Bond posted is to applied to costs/fees

The Court gives basis on sentence. 

ADA Beck informs the Court that after inquiry of Atty. Ahmad, he indicates that former counsel Atty. Raff maintains possession of the Stepwise video.
The Court maintains its previously made protection order. Further the Court orders that Counsel in Possession of the Stepwise Video is to return the Stepwise Video to the State by 4:00pm on 11/6/15, if Atty. Raff does not have possession of the Stepwise Video he is to file a motion to state seeking relief

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Days Credit: 1 day
recess: 4:13pm
Character letters for the defendant submitted by attorney Ahmad
for continuance is granted and new time for sentencing is 10/29/15 at 1:30 pm
Sentencing hearing at 10-29-2015 01:30 pm
Proposed Stipulation & Order for Continuance of 10/9/15 Sentencing Hearing
Alternative presentence investigation report file by Attorney Ahmad
It is ordered that Attorney Ahmad be substituted as attorney of record for the defendant
Proposed order for substitution of attorneys
Sentencing hearing at 10-09-2015 08:30 am
Sentencing hearing at 09-10-2015 08:30 am
to adjourn sentencing hearing
Proposed stip for continuance
Amended PSI
Proposed amdned PSI
From Attorney Raff re PSI
Sentencing hearing on July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling notice
With criminal case settlement agreement form attached.

[MK] case called at 11:47am. 
Defendant Stanley D. Langholff in court with Attorney Francis P. Raff.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
On agreement of the parties, and after ADA Beck provides that bases for requested amendment, the Court grants the State leave to file the Amended Information.
Service of the Amended Information admitted, reading is waived.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Amended Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Langholff guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On request of the Defense, the Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation. Under Statute 972.15(1m), the Court orders the DOC to conduct the Pre-Sentence investigation which will include an evaluation of whether the Defendant is at risk for committing another sex offense as defined in Statute 301.45 (1d) (b). 
recess 12:24pm. 

NEXT:  (1) PSI ordered with added assessment-requirement  (2) Sentencing Hearing on July 9th at 8:30am. (allow three hours)
Letter from Attorney Raff re a change of plea
States motion in limine

Case called at 9:13am [mo]
Defendant Stanley D. Langholff in court with Attorney Francis P. Raff.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

On the Defendant's 4/9/15 Motion in Limine:
--The Court finds that this Motion was filed after the Court's deadline set forth in the Court's scheduling order
--The Court and Attorney Raff have colloquy regarding Branch III Scheduling Order
--The Court finds that Attorney Raff did not interpret the Scheduling Order correctly
--The Court strikes the Defendant's Motion in Limine
--The Court finds that the striking of this Motion will not harm the Defendant
--The Court will not allow any subsequent or second Motion in Limine


On the State's 4/2/15 Motion in Limnie:
--Attorney Raffs confirms receipt of document
--Attorney Raff has no objection to the Motion in its entirety
--The Court grants the State's Motion in Limine 


On the State's 4/2/15 Memorandum of Law Regarding the Admissibility of Photographs:
--The Court grants the State's Memorandum, due to the lack of objection to Motion in Limine paragraph 10 regarding photographs

The Court will not make any decisions as to jury instructions at this time. 
The Court and Counsel have colloquy regarding the stepwise interview video to be played at Trial. 
recess: 9:32am
Defendants
Defendants first set of motions in limine
States
Motion in limine
State's memorandum of law regarding the admissibility of photographs w/cover letter

Case called at 11:33am [mo]
Attorney Francis P. Raff in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance
The Defendant's presence at this hearing had been previously excused by the Court. 
The Court gives rationale and rules on the Defense objections (set forth in the Defense's 3/10/15 amended Motion Exhibit) to specific portions of the interview of the child in the audiovisual recording: 
-- As to the 11:03:48-11:05:06 the Court overrules
--As to the 11:05:06-11:05:23 the Court overrules 
--As to the 11:05:23-11:12:20 the Court overrules 
--As to 11:15:12-11:16:45 the Court overrules 
--As to 11:17:10-11:20:56 the Court overrules
--As to 11:20:56-11:22:46 the Court overrules
--As to 11:24:13-11:25:22 the Court overrules
--As to 11:28:29-11:29:10 the Court strikes any reference to the specified language, however the Court does not strike the rest of the descriptions and articulation of observations given
--As to 11:33:26-11:38:36 the Court overrules
--As to 11:38:36-11:39:06 the Court overrules
--As to 11:40:35-11:40:48 the Court overrules
--As to 11:40:48-11:42:53 the Court overrules
--As to 11:44:24-11:45:21 the Court overrules the objections
--As to 11:48:05-the end of recording the Court orders this portion of recording be edited out; the Defendant's implicit Motion to Strike is granted. 

The Court requires that the State by 4/27/15 provide Atty. Raff and the Court with the final edited version of the audio visual recording, so that Attorney Raff can review it to ensure he is in agreement with how the editing was done. 
recess: 12:04pm
Copy of motion exhibit 1-the motion has been amended to display the timestamps which correlate to the advanced objections submitted by Attorney Raff
Oral ruling on March 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendants exhibit motion #1

Continuation of 2/16/15 Motion Hearing on State's 1/22/15 Notice of Audiovisual Recording of Child's Statements:
case called at 3:33pm. [MK]
Defendant Stanley D. Langholff in court with Attorney Francis Raff.  ADA Theresa Beck appear for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raff files a listing of what portions of the video that he has objections to. This written listing is marked as Defendant's Motion Exhibit #1. 
The Court and counsel discuss a plan that the Court will adjourn the hearing so that it can view the video in chambers, giving consideration to the indicated objections. 
The Court will schedule a time for an oral ruling.
Attorney Raff requests that the Court waive the requirement that Mr. Langholff appear in person at this oral ruling hearing.  ADA Beck indicates that the State has no objection to this request.
The Court excuses the personal appearance of Mr. Langholff at the oral ruling hearing. 
ADA Beck provides the State's positions on several of the objections that Attorney Raff has indicated in his listing. 
The Court requires Attorney Raff to file, within one week, the listing of his objections with the timing numbers converted to the times shown on the time-stamp.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
recess 3:53pm. 

NEXT:  Oral Ruling on March 30th at 11:00am; the Defendant has been excused from appearing personally at this hearing
Order for conditional dissemination of audiovisual recording of child interview
Proposed order
Motion hearing on March 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 10:19am[MO]
Defendant Stanley D. Langholff in court with Attorney Francis P. Raff.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Todays hearing is scheduled on behalf of the State's Notice of Intent to allow the admission of a Stepwise video in place of the child's direct examination in court.
Atty. Raff indicates he objects the use of the State's video in court proceedings.
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty. Raff indicates he objects to use of the video in part and whole.

Atty. Raff indicates his objection has several factors,which does not meet the standard under 967.04(7) regarding being conducive to trustworthiness. 
Atty Raff indicates he objects to the playing of the video, due to the maturity of the victim, he feels she would be able to testify in court, with the same demeanor as in video. 

ADA Beck gives arguments to allow use of video interwiew in proceedings under 967.04(7)
ADA Beck indicates that ALL the factor do not need to be met in order to use the video interview, rather a select combination of factors. 
ADA Beck summarizes the Victim Impact Statements given by the victims parents

Upon inquiry of the Court about the Victim Impact Statements, Atty. Raff indicates that the State is putting a lot of weight onto the impression of the mother of the child. Atty Raff indicates the mother has minimal placement of child. The victims father has greater placement and indicates little change in victim.

The Court determines regardless of what form the video will be in during Jury Trial it will be admitted to evidence.
 The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of a continued Motion Hearing.
The Court orders the State give copy of video interview to Atty. Raff, with the protective provisions that that Atty. Raff is not to copy, disseminate, or share the video. Atty. Raff can allow the defendant and his investigator to view the video in his precense  Atty. Raff is ordered return the video to the State at the conclusion of the case.
The State is to have the copied video available to Atty. Raff in 2 business days

Recess: 11:28am

NEXT: continued Motion Hearing: 3/2/2015 at 2:00pm(allow 1 hour)
Final status/scheduling conference on May 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:00am [MO & MK]
Defendant Stanley D. Langholff in court with Attorney Francis Raff.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Raff indicates that Counsel has not reached an agreement, and wish to proceed to trial. 
Atty. Raff aknowledges reciept of discovery. Atty. Raff says that because of the seriousness of the charges he would need until June to prepare for trial.
ADA Shock verfifies victim rights compliance.
The Court cites statute 971.105, and indicates its intent to expedite the case.
The Court finds and concludes that a June Trial date is not necessary
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court verifies that the Counsel has understanding of Branch III Jury Scheduling Orders. 
Recess: 9:11am



NEXT: (1) Motion Hearing remains on the calendar for 2/16/2015 (2) FSSC:5/4/2015 at 11:00 (3) Jury Trial: 5/7/2015 and 5/8/2015 at 8:30am

Case called at 1:15 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Mark Fremgen presiding for BrIII]
Defendant Stanley D. Langholff appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Francis P. Raff. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Langholff
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived not waived by Defense: Court will schedule preliminary hearing 10 days

Court requires a $5,000 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No direct or indirect contact with A.P.T. (dob: 9/7/02)
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence or contact at A.P.T.'s residence or school or any residence where she may be temporarily residing at
-No discussion of the facts of the case or testimony with Cindy Langholff, Joshua Stahl, Michelle Stahl, or Rachel Nightingale
-No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 14 except as incidental and no child may stay overnight at Mr. Langholff's residence
Recess: 1:32 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 11/24/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
